item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 8, 2025 at 4:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Deck: An Open-Source Cross-Platform Multiplayer Card Game Engine in Flutter (24 points | 1 comment)
2. Do-nothing scripting: the key to gradual automation (2019) (129 points | 21 comments)
3. Collection of one-file C/C++ libraries with no dependencies, primarily for games (25 points | 12 comments)

5. The Leaning Tower of New York (34 points | 20 comments)
6. Obscure Islands I Find Interesting (71 points | 5 comments)
7. No Way Home (3 points | discuss)
8. A tale of several distros joining forces for a common goal: reproducible builds (31 points | 8 comments)
9. Hotline for modern Apple systems (385 points | 84 comments)
10. VSCode’s SSH agent is bananas (537 points | 352 comments)
11. Tapestry by Iconfactory (55 points | 30 comments)
12. Station of despair: What to do if you get stuck at end of Tokyo Chuo Rapid Line (438 points | 271 comments)
13. Insomnia, Control (13 points | discuss)
14. In Praise of Subspecies (15 points | 3 comments)
15. U.K. orders Apple to let it spy on users’ encrypted accounts (562 points | 879 comments)
16. The practical (Unix) problems with .cache and its friends (23 points | 28 comments)
17. Show HN: Automated Sorting of group photos by user defined N people in each pic (18 points | 1 comment)
18. Show HN: FreeDemandLetter – A Weapon for Anyone Who's Sick of Getting Shafted (7 points | 2 comments)
19. The PS2’s backwards compatibility from the engineer who built it (2020) (201 points | 70 comments)
20. Asahi Linux lead developer Hector Martin resigns from Linux kernel (812 points | 795 comments)
21. Starlink in the Falkland Islands – A national emergency situation? (100 points | 110 comments)
22. Colossus, the first large-scale electronic computer (11 points | 1 comment)
23. A brief history of code signing at Mozilla (231 points | 74 comments)
24. LINUX is obsolete (1992) (95 points | 90 comments)
25. Show HN: ExpenseOwl – Simple, self-hosted expense tracker (178 points | 74 comments)
26. A colorful Game of Life (105 points | 18 comments)
27. Ghostwriter – use the reMarkable2 as an interface to vision-LLMs (144 points | 48 comments)
28. Show HN: A website that heatmaps your city based on your housing preferences (280 points | 91 comments)
29. Five coding hats (58 points | 34 comments)
30. Implementing a Game Boy emulator in Ruby (106 points | 9 comments)
